item.title: Help with this nubby error
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[code] String m = e.getActionCommand(); if (m != null) { if(m.equals("internet")) String SYSTEM_ROOT = System.getenv("SYSTEMROOT"); (Runtime.getRuntime()).exec("START " + SYSTEM_ROOT + "\\Program Files\\Mozilla Firefox\\firefox.exe"); JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, "FireFox Loaded!"); } [/code]

u do know that it will do : code.exec("START " + SYSTEM_ROOT + “\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe”);
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, “FireFox Loaded!”);[/code]

even if m is not equal to internet, u should get the “variable m may not be initialized” error :\

to fix put brackets around the

code.exec("START " + SYSTEM_ROOT + “\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe”);
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, “FireFox Loaded!”);[/code]

so it would be :

if(m.equals("internet")) { String SYSTEM_ROOT = System.getenv("SYSTEMROOT"); (Runtime.getRuntime()).exec("START " + SYSTEM_ROOT + "\\Program Files\\Mozilla Firefox\\firefox.exe"); JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, "FireFox Loaded!"); }

and that will also fix the error u are getting

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this nubby error
item.dc:creator: @tedyslilnoob tedyslilnoob
item.description:
@tedyslilnoob wrote:

[code]C:\Documents and Settings\Owner\Desktop\Java\Test.java:147: not a statement
String SYSTEM_ROOT = System.getenv(“SYSTEMROOT”);
^
C:\Documents and Settings\Owner\Desktop\Java\Test.java:147: ‘;’ expected
String SYSTEM_ROOT = System.getenv(“SYSTEMROOT”);
^
2 errors

Tool completed with exit code 1
[/code]

heres the code:

String m = e.getActionCommand(); if (m != null) { if(m.equals("internet")) String SYSTEM_ROOT = System.getenv("SYSTEMROOT"); (Runtime.getRuntime()).exec("START " + SYSTEM_ROOT + "\\Program Files\\Mozilla Firefox\\firefox.exe"); JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, "FireFox Loaded!"); }

thanks
